methods.name: Bucket
methods.description: Create a Bucket object to interact with a Google Cloud Storage bucket.

params.name: options.keyFilename
params.description: • Full path to the JSON key downloaded from the Google Developers Console. Alternatively, you may provide a credentials object.

params.name: options.credentials
params.description: • Credentials object, used in place of a keyFilename.

methods.name: create
methods.description: Create a bucket.

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Delete the bucket.

examples.code: bucket.delete(function(err, apiResponse) {});

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

methods.name: exists
methods.description: Check if the bucket exists.

examples.code: bucket.exists(function(err, exists) {});

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

methods.name: get
methods.description:
Get a bucket if it exists.

You may optionally use this to "get or create" an object by providing an object with autoCreate set to true. Any extra configuration that is normally required for the create method must be contained within this object as well.

params.name: options.autoCreate
params.description: • Automatically create the object if it does not exist. Default: false

methods.name: getMetadata
methods.description:
Get the bucket's metadata.

To set metadata, see storage/bucket#setMetadata.

examples.code: bucket.getMetadata(function(err, metadata, apiResponse) {});

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

methods.name: setMetadata
methods.description: Set the bucket's metadata.

examples.caption: Set website metadata field on the bucket.
Enable versioning for your bucket.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

methods.name: acl
methods.description:
Google Cloud Storage uses access control lists (ACLs) to manage object and bucket access. ACLs are the mechanism you use to share objects with other users and allow other users to access your buckets and objects.

An ACL consists of one or more entries, where each entry grants permissions to an entity. Permissions define the actions that can be performed against an object or bucket (for example, READ or WRITE); the entity defines who the permission applies to (for example, a specific user or group of users).

The acl object on a Bucket instance provides methods to get you a list of the ACLs defined on your bucket, as well as set, update, and delete them.

Buckets also have default ACLs for all created files. Default ACLs specify permissions that all new objects added to the bucket will inherit by default. You can add, delete, get, and update entities and permissions for these as well with storage/bucket#acl.default.

examples.caption: Make a bucket's contents publicly readable.

methods.name: acl.default
methods.description: Google Cloud Storage Buckets have default ACLs for all created files. You can add, delete, get, and update entities and permissions for these as well. The method signatures and examples are all the same, after only prefixing the method call with default.

methods.name: combine
methods.description: Combine multiple files into one new file.

params.name: sources
params.description: • The source files that will be combined.

params.name: destination
params.description: • The file you would like the source files combined into.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request

exceptions.description: if a non-array is provided as sources argument.
if less than two sources are provided.
if content type can't be determined for the destination file.

methods.name: createChannel
methods.description: Create a channel that will be notified when objects in this bucket changes.

params.name: id
params.description: • The ID of the channel to create.

params.name: config.address
params.description: • The address where notifications are delivered for this channel.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request

methods.name: deleteFiles
methods.description:
Iterate over the bucket's files, calling file.delete() on each.

This is not an atomic request. A delete attempt will be made for each file individually. Any one can fail, in which case only a portion of the files you intended to be deleted would have.

Operations are performed in parallel, up to 10 at once. The first error breaks the loop and will execute the provided callback with it. Specify { force: true } to suppress the errors until all files have had a chance to be processed.

The query object passed as the first argument will also be passed to storage/bucket#getFiles.

examples.caption: Delete all of the files in the bucket.
examples.code: bucket.deleteFiles(function(err) {});

examples.caption: By default, if a file cannot be deleted, this method will stop deleting files from your bucket. You can override this setting with force: true.
The first argument to this method acts as a query to storage/bucket#getFiles. As an example, you can delete files which match a prefix.

params.name: query
params.description: • Query object. See storage/bucket#getFiles for all of the supported properties.

params.name: query.force
params.description: • Suppress errors until all files have been processed.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An API error or array of errors from files that were not able to be deleted.

methods.name: file
methods.description: Create a File object. See storage/file to see how to handle the different use cases you may have.

examples.code: var file = bucket.file('my-existing-file.png');

params.name: name
params.description: • The name of the file in this bucket.

params.name: options.generation
params.description: • Only use a specific revision of this file.

params.name: options.key
params.description: • A custom encryption key. See Customer-supplied Encryption Keys.

methods.name: getFiles
methods.description: Get File objects for the files currently in the bucket.

examples.caption: If your bucket has versioning enabled, you can get all of your files scoped to their generation.
To control how many API requests are made and page through the results manually, set autoPaginate to false.
Get the files from your bucket as a readable object stream.
If you anticipate many results, you can end a stream early to prevent unnecessary processing and API requests.

params.name: query.delimiter
params.description: • Results will contain only objects whose names, aside from the prefix, do not contain delimiter. Objects whose names, aside from the prefix, contain delimiter will have their name truncated after the delimiter, returned in apiResponse.prefixes. Duplicate prefixes are omitted.

params.name: query.prefix
params.description: • Filter results to objects whose names begin with this prefix.

params.name: query.maxApiCalls
params.description: • Maximum number of API calls to make.

params.name: query.maxResults
params.description: • Maximum number of items plus prefixes to return.

params.name: query.pageToken
params.description: • A previously-returned page token representing part of the larger set of results to view.

params.name: query.versions
params.description: • If true, returns File objects scoped to their versions.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request

params.name: callback.nextQuery
params.description: • If present, query with this object to check for more results.

methods.name: makePrivate
methods.description:
Make the bucket listing private.

You may also choose to make the contents of the bucket private by specifying includeFiles: true. This will automatically run storage/file#makePrivate for every file in the bucket.

When specifying includeFiles: true, use force: true to delay execution of your callback until all files have been processed. By default, the callback is executed after the first error. Use force to queue such errors until all files have been processed, after which they will be returned as an array as the first argument to your callback.

NOTE: This may cause the process to be long-running and use a high number of requests. Use with caution.

examples.caption: Make the bucket private.
examples.code: bucket.makePrivate(function(err) {});

examples.caption: Make the bucket and its contents private.
Make the bucket and its contents private, using force to suppress errors until all files have been processed.

params.name: options.includeFiles
params.description: • Make each file in the bucket private. Default: false.

params.name: options.force
params.description: • Queue errors occurred while making files private until all files have been processed.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request

methods.name: makePublic
methods.description:
Make the bucket publicly readable.

You may also choose to make the contents of the bucket publicly readable by specifying includeFiles: true. This will automatically run storage/file#makePublic for every file in the bucket.

When specifying includeFiles: true, use force: true to delay execution of your callback until all files have been processed. By default, the callback is executed after the first error. Use force to queue such errors until all files have been processed, after which they will be returned as an array as the first argument to your callback.

NOTE: This may cause the process to be long-running and use a high number of requests. Use with caution.

examples.caption: Make the bucket publicly readable.
examples.code: bucket.makePublic(function(err) {});

examples.caption: Make the bucket and its contents publicly readable.
Make the bucket and its contents publicly readable, using force to suppress errors until all files have been processed.

params.name: options.includeFiles
params.description: • Make each file in the bucket publicly readable. Default: false.

params.name: options.force
params.description: • Queue errors occurred while making files public until all files have been processed.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request

methods.name: upload
methods.description:
Upload a file to the bucket. This is a convenience method that wraps storage/file#createWriteStream.

You can specify whether or not an upload is resumable by setting options.resumable. Resumable uploads are enabled by default if your input file is larger than 5 MB.

For faster crc32c computation, you must manually install fast-crc32c:

$ npm install --save fast-crc32c

examples.caption: The easiest way to upload a file.
It's not always that easy. You will likely want to specify the filename used when your new file lands in your bucket. You may also want to set metadata or customize other options.
You can also have a file gzip'd on the fly.
You may also re-use a File object, storage/file, that references the file you wish to create or overwrite.
To use Customer-supplied Encryption Keys, provide the encryptionKey option.

params.name: localPath
params.description: • The fully qualified path to the file you wish to upload to your bucket.

params.name: options.destination
params.description: • The place to save your file. If given a string, the file will be uploaded to the bucket using the string as a filename. When given a File object, your local file will be uploaded to the File object's bucket and under the File object's name. Lastly, when this argument is omitted, the file is uploaded to your bucket using the name of the local file.

params.name: options.encryptionKey
params.description: • A custom encryption key. See Customer-supplied Encryption Keys.

params.name: options.gzip
params.description: • Automatically gzip the file. This will set options.metadata.contentEncoding to gzip.

params.name: options.offset
params.description: • The starting byte of the upload stream, for resuming an interrupted upload. Defaults to 0.

params.name: options.predefinedAcl
params.description:
• Apply a predefined set of access controls to this object.

    Acceptable values are:

    • authenticatedRead - Object owner gets OWNER access, and allAuthenticatedUsers get READER access.

    • bucketOwnerFullControl - Object owner gets OWNER access, and project team owners get OWNER access.

    • bucketOwnerRead - Object owner gets OWNER access, and project team owners get READER access.

    • private - Object owner gets OWNER access.

    • projectPrivate - Object owner gets OWNER access, and project team members get access according to their roles.

    • publicRead - Object owner gets OWNER access, and allUsers get READER access.

params.name: options.resumable
params.description: • Force a resumable upload. (default: true for files larger than 5 MB).

params.name: options.uri
params.description: • The URI for an already-created resumable upload. See storage/file#createResumableUpload.

params.name: options.validation
params.description: • Possible values: "md5", "crc32c", or false. By default, data integrity is validated with an MD5 checksum for maximum reliability. CRC32c will provide better performance with less reliability. You may also choose to skip validation completely, however this is not recommended.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request

methods.name: acl.owners
methods.description:
An object of convenience methods to add or delete owner ACL permissions for a given entity.

The supported methods include:

  • myFile.acl.owners.addAllAuthenticatedUsers
  • myFile.acl.owners.deleteAllAuthenticatedUsers
  • myFile.acl.owners.addAllUsers
  • myFile.acl.owners.deleteAllUsers
  • myFile.acl.owners.addDomain
  • myFile.acl.owners.deleteDomain
  • myFile.acl.owners.addGroup
  • myFile.acl.owners.deleteGroup
  • myFile.acl.owners.addProject
  • myFile.acl.owners.deleteProject
  • myFile.acl.owners.addUser
  • myFile.acl.owners.deleteUser

examples.caption: Add a user as an owner of a file.
For reference, the above command is the same as running the following.

methods.name: acl.readers
methods.description:
An object of convenience methods to add or delete reader ACL permissions for a given entity.

The supported methods include:

  • myFile.acl.readers.addAllAuthenticatedUsers
  • myFile.acl.readers.deleteAllAuthenticatedUsers
  • myFile.acl.readers.addAllUsers
  • myFile.acl.readers.deleteAllUsers
  • myFile.acl.readers.addDomain
  • myFile.acl.readers.deleteDomain
  • myFile.acl.readers.addGroup
  • myFile.acl.readers.deleteGroup
  • myFile.acl.readers.addProject
  • myFile.acl.readers.deleteProject
  • myFile.acl.readers.addUser
  • myFile.acl.readers.deleteUser

examples.caption: Add a user as a reader of a file.
examples.code: myFile.acl.readers.addUser('email@example.com', function(err, aclObject) {});

examples.caption: For reference, the above command is the same as running the following.

methods.description:

  • myFile.acl.writers.deleteAllUsers
  • myFile.acl.writers.addDomain
  • myFile.acl.writers.deleteDomain

  • myFile.acl.writers.deleteGroup
  • myFile.acl.writers.addProject
  • myFile.acl.writers.deleteProject
  • myFile.acl.writers.addUser
  • myFile.acl.writers.deleteUser

examples.caption: Add a user as a writer of a file.
examples.code: myFile.acl.writers.addUser('email@example.com', function(err, aclObject) {});

examples.caption: For reference, the above command is the same as running the following.

methods.name: acl.add
methods.description: Add access controls on a storage/bucket or storage/file.

examples.caption: For file ACL operations, you can also specify a generation property. Here is how you would grant ownership permissions to a user on a specific revision of a file.

params.name: options.role
params.description: • Permissions allowed for the defined entity. See storage#acl.

params.name: options.generation
params.description: • File Objects Only Select a specific revision of this file (as opposed to the latest version, the default).

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request

methods.name: acl.delete
methods.description: Delete access controls on a storage/bucket or storage/file.

examples.caption: For file ACL operations, you can also specify a generation property.

params.name: options.generation
params.description: • File Objects Only Select a specific revision of this file (as opposed to the latest version, the default).

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request

methods.name: acl.get
methods.description: Get access controls on a storage/bucket or storage/file. If an entity is omitted, you will receive an array of all applicable access controls.

examples.caption: Get all access controls.
For file ACL operations, you can also specify a generation property.

params.name: options
params.description: • Configuration object. If you want to receive a list of all access controls, pass the callback function as the only argument.

params.name: options.generation
params.description: • File Objects Only Select a specific revision of this file (as opposed to the latest version, the default).

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request

params.name: options.generation

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request
